hr.p: In an email exchange between Matt Whitlock and Pieter Wuille on January 21, 2015, Matt suggested changing the parameters in a C++ code to be more in line with the C++ spirit. Specifically, he proposed changing (const std::vector &sig, size_t &off) to (std::vector::const_iterator &itr, std::vector::const_iterator end). Pieter agreed that this change would be more in line with C++, but noted that part of the motivation for including C++ code was to match the exact code used in past Bitcoin Core releases for interpreting signatures as standard.
